text: in april nineteen sixty eight after
president lyndon b johnson said he would
not run for re-election the race for the
White House was wide open stewart mott
surveyed the entire field flirting with
Republicans like George Romney and
Nelson Rockefeller before throwing his
support to the Liberal Democrat Eugene
McCarthy Nelson Rockefeller seemed like
a possibly viable candidate for the
Republican nomination I took on a
double-page ad in The New York Times ads
ascent George Romney thank you for
telling it like it is I'm sorry
withdrawn all those Rockefellers your
turn and formation was committee had a
coupon send him but when Rockefeller
went nowhere terms of making decision to
runners a false start I turned to
McCarthy you a lot of my friends had
urged me get involved with the McCarthy
campaign I spent the next several months
raising money and giving money to the
McCarthy campaign I went out to Chicago
and was gassed along with others very
memorable part of my life that year 68
and then all again in 72 I'm started
backing George McGovern I was probably
the largest single donor to the McGovern
campaign and a heavy duty fundraiser
those were very heady days and I got to
be known as a maverick coming from a
very Republican General Motors family
and that part of my career I even though
I back you might say losers I'm glad I
did I think they made a very important
statement for their error your political
contributions landed you a prominent
place on President Nixon's enemies list
I'm son Nicholas enemies list not just
once but three times there are only two
other people severly listed Paul Newman
the other was a Daniel Schorr CBS White
House correspondent who got fired for
being too harsh on mix I wore the
designation
anatomy of the White House with as a

very seriously it wasn't a genuinely
Alixe unless it was john dean's list
after all now after three elections in
which you back losers do you feel that
change can be achieved through

believe in the political process yes I
think the answer i do think all positive
change can come about it's like sweeping
their genes of stables or sis was
rolling a boulder up the hill i look
forward to a day when we have a
philosopher-king as president one who
the great majority of the united states
public of kin and and nations throughout
the world can respect there's a building
around the corner from the Supreme Court
hard by the Capitol called the Mott
house it's also been referred to as the
house of unamerican activities what goes
on in there having lived in New York all
and be previously in Flint Michigan I
realized that Washington DC was a place
that I needed to spend a lot of time but
it would service by apartment and office
as well as extra space to lease out to
other groups most recently the ACLU had
his Washington office there and now the
Democratic Senate campaign committee I
love the fact that it's become such a
feature in the lives of Washington
liberal progressive politics I'm very
proud of the of my ownership of the
house I never meant were to be called
the Mott house but eventually i exceeded
to bath because everybody else was
calling it the Mott house
how do you want to be remembered what's
your legacy I can't say that I've really
felt that there's a a purpose on earth
for which I was destined I've tried to
leave the planet Earth a bit better
often i found my campsite i've spent
probably three-quarters or two-thirds
anyway of the financial resources i have
had available Oh to me on philanthropic
or public service or political activity
I'm not inspired to have a great deal
additional wealth and don't need fancy
things to satisfy me I cherished the
relationships I've had with people but
I've also had fun along the way and I
can't imagine living otherwise
